intro: Leandra capillaris, commonly known as the silky leandra, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
